name: Of the Earth Institute of Indigenous Cultures and Teachings
category: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas
description: This organization, led by Elder Marika Alvarado, focuses on empowering people to grow medicinal plants and herbs, aiming to restore native medicinal plants and support community health and well-being. They provide resources like containers, soils, seeds, and starter plants to individuals and families
services: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas consultation

name: The Herbal Action Project
category: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas
description: Co-founded by Shaman Jesus Garcia and his sisters, this initiative fosters homeschooling support by opening their garden to children, teenagers, and adults. They focus on flowers, herbs, and food connected to ancestral Mexican roots, with a special "spirit essence therapy bed" for teenagers
services: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas consultation

name: Texas Native Health - Native Pathways Program
category: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas
description: This youth empowerment and education initiative by Texas Native Health provides cultural education for Native American/Alaskan Native students. While not exclusively gardening, it aims to connect youth with their heritage and offers extracurricular activities
services: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas consultation

name: Choctaw Nation Agriculture Demonstration Centers
address: Various locations within the Choctaw Nation's service area (Texas may have outreach programs)
category: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas
description: These centers provide hands-on workshops and demonstrations to promote sustainable gardening practices for tribal members, supporting healthier lifestyles

name: Collin County Master Gardeners Association - Horticulture Therapy
address: Various locations in Collin County, Texas
category: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas
description: This program engages people in gardening activities to enhance their quality of life, developing programs for nursing homes, rehabilitation centers, and special needs camps

name: Community Gardens (Bastrop)
category: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas
description: This nursery is dedicated to promoting Texas Native plants and helping the community thrive through gardening. They offer assistance in selecting plants and emphasize the benefits of native species

name: Native Son Gardens
category: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas
description: This company focuses on designing and installing sustainable, drought-resistant gardens using Texas native landscapes to restore the local ecosystem for flora and fauna
services: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas consultation

name: Green Sleeves Nursery
category: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas
description: Owned by William Glenn, this nursery grows Texas native plants from locally collected seeds, emphasizing intentional designs that are resilient and beneficial to the ecosystem
services: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas consultation

name: Warrior and Family Support Center Healing Gardens
address: San Antonio, Texas (part of the San Antonio Military Medical Center)
category: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas
description: These gardens assist soldiers and their families through physical and emotional recovery, utilizing therapeutic garden design principles

name: Intertribal Community Council of Texas
category: American-Indian-owned Therapeutic gardening programs in Texas
description: This organization is proposing a Native American Community Center that would include a garden, aiming to preserve history and culture and provide support services
